â€˜ Geostorm â€™ was directed by Dean Devlin also known for producing Independence Day 1998 â€™ s Godzilla and etc and stars Gerard Butler as a scientist who crea ted a system of satellites called Dutch Boy that controls climate on a global scale and had prevented disasters from happening However it went out of control by some viruses a couple years later causing disasters all around the world including Hong Kong Tokyo Reo and so on What is worse it â€™ s got only a few hours till a huge environmental disaster called Geostorm causing the end of the world occurs In order to fix the satellite and save the c itizens the scientist must go up to the plane with help from the members of the station as well as his brother as a politician played by Jim Sturgess ).... I had no anticipation for this film and hadn â€™ t even known what the movie was about but thought it was kinda underrated after seeing it Although I could expect who the rat was unluckily because I knew which actor would be likely to be a villain and it lost my ex citements a bit but the story was not as bad as lots of people say perhaps just because I like this sort of space disaster film. What I found a bit annoying and dizzy was its editing so that I felt like I would get motion sick or something cos of things seen out of focus Whereas its visual effects were as I hoped marvellous and what I expected to be as a film taking place in the sp ace. But the one big mistake that the director made was the choice of an actor as a rat that would â€™ ve been a big twist in that movie if I hadn â€™ t been able to predict it I reckon most of you if you have seen most of the movies starring him â€, would be disappointed in that twist Anyway what I wanna say to you who haven â€™ t seen this movie is that it â€™ s not that bad though occasionally found some scenes a bit dull and slow I enjoyed it and didn â€™ t feel sleepy or anything So hope you can enjoy this movie as much as I did. Thank you for reading my brief review of â€˜ Geostorm â€™!.

An American disaster film.. You might feel that this is familiar somehow when you see this movie Actually this is what I felt. It reminds me Armageddon San Andreas or that sort of movies. The most unsuitable person for this mission was actually the most suitable person. Disasters family issues save the world and a predictable ending but the things happened weren â€™ t caused by nature but human That was an enjoyable part for me.. Sarah was the best.

I don â€™ t know just how many sh * tty movies it â€™ s gonna take for Gerard Butler to finally go away. but we can certainly take away his title as an A List actor away from him. After Olympus Has Fallen I thought we were gonna see the action hero Butler we all fell in love with in 300. But with London Has Fallen Gods of Egypt and with t his movie Iâ€™ve given up on this guy. It s every single cliched familiar disaster movie you ve seen done AGAIN But hey if San Andreas Into The Storm or Independence Day 2 just wasn t enough for you then you ll still probably be unsatisfied. I was expecting this movie to be a disaster CG fiesta but most of this movie actually takes place in sp ace.. So it plays out like a cheap version of Gravity With no accurate physics of that movie. Everything is familiar predictable and the c haracters are terrible They re the absolute stereotypes of these kind of movies. This movie should have gone straight to DVD and died there ....... along with Gerard Butler s career .....
